intro: Elatostema grandifolium, commonly known as the large-leaf elatostema, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia. The plant is characterized by its succulent, ovate leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. It produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, which are typically borne on short pedicels. Elatostema grandifolium is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and relatively low maintenance requirements.
